issues.description: Return type of messageOnMilk() is inconsistent between the problem statement and the solution. The problem (UML and textual spec) requires Milkable.messageOnMilk() to return a String (the text "[Animal Type] [name] is milked"), and the template/Main expects to print the returned message. The solution, however, declares Milkable.messageOnMilk() to return boolean and implements it by printing the message to stdout and returning true. This discrepancy will confuse students about the correct signature and expected behavior and will make student implementations (returning String) incompatible with the provided solution implementation and some automated tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the problem statement: change the Milkable interface method to return String (String messageOnMilk()) and update Goat and Seal implementations to return the formatted message string (e.g. "Goat Buttinsky is milked") instead of printing and returning boolean. This preserves the educational intent (students implement returning the message) and keeps Main/template printing the returned String. Alternatively, if the intended design was to return boolean, update the problem statement and UML to specify a boolean return and clarify that implementations should print the textual message to stdout — but preferring the first option (change solution to String) will match the stated requirements.
